intro: Dysoxylum sibuyanense, commonly known as the Sibuyan ironwood, is a tropical tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and thick, leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in lowland to montane rainforests, reaching heights of up to 30 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a distinctive yellowish-green color, while its fruits are woody capsules containing several seeds. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
